sentences.sentence: Not long after, in the evening, the seven dwarfs( 小矮人 ) came home.
How shocked( 震惊的 ) they were when they saw their dear little Snow White lying on the ground!
She did not move, and seemed to be dead.
They lifted her up, and, as they saw that she was laced( 被束 ) too tightly( 紧紧地 ), they cut the laces( 系带 ).
Then she began to breathe( 呼吸 ) a little, and after a while came to life again.
When the dwarfs heard what had happened they said, “The old woman was really the wicked( 恶毒的 ) Queen. Take care, and let no one come in when we are not with you.”
But the wicked Queen, when she had reached home went in front of the glass and asked:
“Mirror( 镜子 ), mirror, on the wall,
Who is the fairest of us all?”
And it answered:
“Queen, you are fairest of all I see,
But over the hills, where the seven dwarfs dwell( 居住 ),
Snow White is still alive and well,
And none is as fair as she.”
When she heard that, she turned white with fear and anger, for she knew that little Snow White was still alive.
“But now,” she said, “I will think of something that shall put an end to you,” and using her knowledge of magic she made a poisoned( 有毒的 ) comb( 梳子 ).
Then she disguised( 伪装 ) herself and took the shape of another old woman.
So she went over the seven mountains to the seven dwarfs, knocked at the door, and cried, “Good things to sell, cheap, cheap!”
Little Snow White looked out and said, “Go away. I must not let any one come in.”
“I suppose you can look at least,” said the old woman, and pulled the poisoned comb out and held it up.
It pleased( （使）开心 ) the girl so well that she let herself be tricked( 被骗 ), and opened the door.
When they had made a bargain( 交易 ) the old woman said, “Now I will comb( 梳理 ) your hair properly for once.”

Poor little Snow White had no suspicion( 怀疑 ), and let the old woman do as she pleased, but hardly had she put the comb in her hair than the poison( 毒药 ) in it took effect( 起作用 ), and the girl fell down, unconscious( 不省人事的 ).
“Now, ‘fairest of us all’, ” said the wicked woman, “you will trouble me no more,” and she went away.
But fortunately( 幸运地 ) it was almost evening, and the seven dwarfs were soon home.
When they saw Snow White lying as if dead upon the ground, they at once suspected( 怀疑 ) her stepmother( 继母 ), and they looked and found the poisoned comb.
Scarcely( 刚...就 ) had they taken it out when Snow White woke up again, and told them what had happened.
Then they warned her once more to be careful, and to open the door to no one.
The Queen, at home, went in front of the glass and said:
“Mirror, mirror, on the wall,
Who is the fairest of us all?”
And it answered:
“Queen, you are fairest of all I see,
But over the hills, where the seven dwarfs dwell,
Snow White is still alive and well,
And none is as fair as she.”
When she heard the mirror speak those words, she trembled( 颤抖 ) and shook with rage( 盛怒 ).
“Snow White shall die,” she cried, “even if it costs me my life!”
Then she went into a quite secret, lonely room, where no one ever came, and there she made a very poisonous( 有毒的 ) apple.
Outside it looked pretty, half green and half red, so that everyone who saw it wanted to eat it; but whoever ate a piece of it must surely die.
When the apple was ready she painted her face, and dressed herself up as a country woman, and so she went over the seven mountains to the seven dwarfs.
She knocked at the door. Snow White put her head out of the window and said, “I cannot let anyone in; the seven dwarfs have forbidden( 禁止 ) me.”
“It is all the same to me,” answered the woman. “I shall soon get rid( 卖掉 ) of my apples. Here, I will give you one.”
“No,” said Snow White, “I dare( 敢 ) not take anything.”
“Are you afraid of poison?” said the old woman. “Look, I will cut the apple in two pieces; you eat the red half, and I will eat the green half.”
The apple was so cunningly( 狡猾地 ) made that only the red half was poisoned.
Snow White longed for( 渴望 ) the fine apple, and when she saw that the woman ate part of it she could resist( 忍住 ) no longer, and stretched( 伸出 ) out her hand and took the poisonous half.
But hardly had she taken a bit of it into her mouth than she fell down dead.
Then the Queen looked at her with a dreadful( 可怕的 ) look, and laughed aloud and said,
“White as snow, red as blood, black as ebony( 乌木 )! This time the dwarfs cannot wake you up again.”
And when she asked of the Mirror at home:
“Mirror, mirror, on the wall,
Who is the fairest of us all?”
It answered at last:
“Now you are fairest of them all.”
Then her envious( 嫉妒的 ) heart was at peace, in so far as an envious heart can be at peace.

article_info.previous: 七个小矮人回家后发现家里多了一个可爱的少女，一番商量后，他们收留了“白雪公主”。恶毒的王后得知“白雪公主”仍然活着后贼心不死，再次设计勒死了白雪公主。
article_info.share_words: How shocked they were when they saw their dear little Snow White lying on the ground! She did not move, and seemed to be dead.

question.cn: 七个小矮人警告“白雪公主”什么？
question.en: What did the seven dwarfs warn “Snow White” of?

options.cn: 警告她要小心并且不要给任何人开门。
options.en: They warned her to be careful and to open the door to no one.

options.cn: 警告她要小心并且藏在门后面。
options.en: They warned her to be careful and hide behind the door.

analysis: 文中提到：“When the dwarfs heard what had happened they said, 'The old woman was really the wicked Queen. Take care, and let no one come in when we are not with you.'”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 恶毒的王后是怎么知道“白雪公主”仍然活着的？
question.en: How did the wicked Queen know that “Snow White” was still alive?

options.cn: 她暗中监视着“白雪公主”。

options.en: Her maid told her that she was still alive.
She knew this through the magic mirror.

analysis: 由原文可知，王后之所以知道“白雪公主”仍然活着是因为她有一面魔镜，魔镜从来不说谎，王后是通过魔镜才知道“白雪公主”还活着的消息的，因此答案选C。

question.en: How could the poisonous apple be described?

options.cn: 一半有毒，一半可以食用。
options.en: It was made half poisonous and half edible.

analysis: 文中提到：“The apple was so cunningly made that only the red half was poisoned.”因此答案选A。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第74天
